list_definition.mean_english: sự đồng cảm, sự thương cảm
list_definition.definition: a feeling of pity or sorrow for a person in trouble

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: When her husband died, she received many letters of sympathy.

list_definition.mean_english: sự đồng cảm, sự đồng tình
list_definition.definition: the state or feeling of being in agreement with, or of being able to understand, the attitude or feelings of another person

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I have no sympathy with such a stupid attitude
Are you in sympathy with the strikers?

list_ex_of_english: Activists with pro-labour sympathies assumed advisory roles in key ministries.
Many marriages are saved by the activities and sympathies of the magistrates dealing with those matrimonial cases.
Such sympathies are often in direct contrast to the academic (and middle-class) scholar.
However, my own sympathies in issues of this kind tend towards the liberal end of the spectrum.
I quite agree that in a case of that kind our sympathies become very readily involved.
If a man is always going to be labelled with an alien name, then and then only can he be expected to maintain alien sympathies.
I speak as an "oldster," a grandfather and a man of advanced years, and my sympathies lie with the elderly in that sense.
He said he thought he would have their sympathies on this point.
